description: A buffer overflow in Smart Card authentication code in gpkcsp.dll in Microsoft Windows XP through SP3 and Server 2003 through SP2 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the target computer, provided that the computer is joined in a Windows domain and has Remote Desktop Protocol connectivity (or Terminal Services) enabled.

product.name: Microsoft Windows Server 2003 SP1, SP2 Windows XP - SP3

enisaIdProduct.product_version: Microsoft Windows Server 2003 SP1, SP2 Windows XP - SP3
